headline: Donald Trump Trump Businesses Got 78 Million Foreign Governments During Presidency House Dem
summary: During former President Donald Trump’s presidency, his businesses received at least $7.8 million from governments and officials from countries like China and Saudi Arabia, astaff reportby House Democrats said Thursday.The Details:In the report, Democrats on the House Oversight Committeearguedthat the payments by 20 different countries violated the Constitution’s foreign emoluments clause, which forbids federal officials from accepting gifts without congressional approval. Most of the payments, totaling $5.57 million, came from China.Donation Disagreement:A spokesman for Trump toldFox News (Right bias)that House Democrats were “desperate tosave face for Hunter Biden,” adding that “foreign profits were donated in full to the United States Treasury.” However, the House report said these donations excluded part-owned properties and “still allowed former President Trump to retain significant emoluments in the form of revenues, which its policy excluded from the funds designated for donation.”How the Media Covered It:Coverage often reflected partisan views on Trump and was generally featured less prominently in right-rated outlets. While aBreitbart (Right bias)headline framed the report as mere allegations,The New York Times (Lean Left bias)said Trump had engaged in “the kind of conduct the G.O.P. is grasping topin on President Biden.”
